body:
Fellow -5er here. Were your unpopular comments true and in good faith? Then post them again, and revel in the consequences. "Reputation points" around here are pretty one-sided, and it's a bullshit anonymous comment board filled with 12-year-old shit-stirrers. No big.

If you really want reputation points, create another free anonymous account and start agreeing with the preferred point of view around here. But do ask yourself, "If my account was hacked and my posts made public to my family, friends, and employer, would I be proud or ashamed?"

Carry on.
body_html:
Fellow -5er here. Were your unpopular comments true and in good faith? Then post them again, and revel in the consequences. "Reputation points" around here are pretty one-sided, and it's a bullshit anonymous comment board filled with 12-year-old shit-stirrers. No big.

If you really want reputation points, create another free anonymous account and start agreeing with the preferred point of view around here. But do ask yourself, "If my account was hacked and my posts made public to my family, friends, and employer, would I be proud or ashamed?"

Carry on.
